block.p: Jane DiGiacomo and Miles Travis Parker were married yesterday at Louse Point Beach in East Hampton, N.Y. Dorothy Dai-en Friedman, a Buddhist priest, officiated, with Michel Engu Dobbs, also a Buddhist priest, taking part.

The bride, 38, is keeping her name. Until last Thursday, she was a partner at Twomey, Latham, Shea, Kelley, Dubin & Quartararo, a law firm in Riverhead, N.Y. She graduated from Barnard and received her law degree, magna cum laude, from the University of Minnesota. She is a daughter of John Jackmore of Saddle River, N.J., and the late Joanne Hanlon.

Jane DiGiacomo and Miles Travis Parker were married yesterday at Louse Point Beach in East Hampton, N.Y. Dorothy Dai-en Friedman, a Buddhist priest, officiated, with Michel Engu Dobbs, also a Buddhist priest, taking part.

Jane DiGiacomo and Miles Travis Parker were married yesterday at Louse Point Beach in East Hampton, N.Y. Dorothy Dai-en Friedman, a Buddhist priest, officiated, with Michel Engu Dobbs, also a Buddhist priest, taking part.

The bride, 38, is keeping her name. Until last Thursday, she was a partner at Twomey, Latham, Shea, Kelley, Dubin & Quartararo, a law firm in Riverhead, N.Y. She graduated from Barnard and received her law degree, magna cum laude, from the University of Minnesota. She is a daughter of John Jackmore of Saddle River, N.J., and the late Joanne Hanlon.

The bridegroom, 39, is a freelance software designer in East Hampton. He graduated from the University of Utah and has a master's in computer science from Johns Hopkins. He is the son of Susan Keene of Weaverville, N.C., and Robert Parker of Minneapolis.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce, as did the bridegroom's.
